1468953877353484290.text: We've got more work to do - and while I was certainly a little tired walking off the House floor after 10:30 last night, I was proud to be able to cast so many votes to help improve the lives of Americans. (end.)

1468953876216926212.text: And I've been proud to be a part of a @HouseDemocrats caucus that has worked tirelessly to do just that through the passage of a historic infrastructure bill and the #BuildBackBetter Act. 7/

1468953874627137543.text: These bills may not grab all the headlines but they are really, really important. I didn't come to Congress to score political points or rack up cable news hits - I came to help make people's lives better. 6/

1468953873092001799.text: Now here's what you might not read in the news - all of these bills were supported on an overwhelmingly bipartisan basis! (As was my bill)  5/

1468953870734745610.text: One of my bills, the CARING for Social Determinants Act was included in that list. My bill would help keep Americans healthier by addressing some of the conditions that impact health, i.e. housing, transportation, education, and so much more. 4/

1468953869254205466.text: The bills ranged from helping combat the opioid epidemic through stronger patient protections, helping accelerate access to therapies for ALS, and condemning the ongoing genocide of Uyghurs in China. 3/

1468953867970826240.text: We were voting on what are called "suspension bills". Bills that aren't particularly controversial but are incredibly important. Last night we voted on 30 of them! (That's a huge number for any vote series.) 2/

1468953866473394180.text: I know if you watch too much cable news, it can seem like all that gets done in Washington is partisan fighting and not much else - but I want to tell you a quick story about why my colleagues and I were on the House floor until about 10:30 last night. 1/

1399341148200751104.text: We come together to remember our history, to say the names of the fallen so that we may never forget the humanity of their sacrifice. And we come together to recommit ourselves to those truly unique values we hold so dear. #MemorialDay

1399341147076677640.text: But on #MemorialDay, we come together to shed our political, geographical, religious, and social differences to acknowledge the magnitude of that sacrifice.

1399341145860231169.text: There are no words that can properly quantify the debt that we owe those who made that ultimate sacrifice - nor are there words that can bring a full measure of comfort to their families, who themselves have sacrificed immeasurably.

1399341144731959297.text: The ideals that founded and have sustained this great nation are truly unique and indelible. What makes them, and us, more unique is that so many willingly fight, sacrifice, and die for those values and ideals.

1399341142534152196.text: There is simply no greater or profound sacrifice that one can make than to lay down their life for their country. On Memorial Day, we remember and honor those who, in the words of Lincoln, gave their last full measure of devotion. https://t.co/kfzXgCDd5R

1397221798580785158.text: The rise in antisemitism we've seen recently in our country is abhorrent and unacceptable. I stand with our Jewish friends and neighbors as we speak with a loud and unified voice that hate has no home here.

1397195675117531139.text: May we continue to change it for the better in his memory

1397195674135969797.text: Let us never forget that George’s life mattered — and that the lives of countless others whose names we know and don’t know matter too. But as we mark 1 year since his passing, we can also recognize the truth in the words of his daughter, Gianna — George Floyd changed the world.

1397195673045544967.text: Our work is not done. And while the conviction of George Floyd’s killer provided some measure of relief, we cannot and we must not rest until we channel that pain into purpose and turn protest into policy. We cannot rest until we pass the Justice in Policing Act in his name.

1397195671925624834.text: 1 year ago, today, a family lost a brother, a son, and a father. As the mother of a Black son, listening to George Floyd cry out for his mother will haunt me forever. 1364636546381606917.text: When I learned of the full scope and breadth of Ms. Shadd Cary’s accomplishments, I was stunned to learn there were no formal memorials to her work in her home state of Delaware. That changes today.

1341196710555639809.text:
Let me also say this - it's unacceptable that it took Congress nearly 8 months to pass another #COVID relief bill. 

I know you're frustrated. 

I'm frustrated too.

1341196709859364871.text: Additional $$$ for contact tracing & testing. While the vaccine gives us hope on the horizon & light at the end of the tunnel, we're not out of the woods yet.

1341196709091811328.text:
One of the issues I'm most passionate about & one I've worked w/ @RepVeasey on - expanding broadband infrastructure 💻

One of the biggest issues we've seen highlighted during #COVID is the digital divide - this bill will help us work to close it.

1341196708370403328.text: One of the biggest issues we heard about from state & local partners like @JohnCarneyDE & @MattMeyerDE - extending the deadline to use CARES funding by a year, until December of next year.

1341196707611238402.text:
Provides $25 billion for rental assistance & extends the eviction moratorium by a month. 

I know a month might not sound like a lot, but it will help us bridge the gap to the Biden-Harris Admin

1341196706885623808.text: An additional $284 billion for PPP through March of next year, with a sizeable set-aside for CDFI's which will help ensure those funds get to the smallest of small and minority-owned businesses.

1341196706185154563.text:
Fed. unemployment extended by 11 weeks at $300.

Again, not as much as we wanted and an area I'll keep fighting for.

1341196705425989633.text:
American families need help and they need it now. 

637k Delaware adults & 233k kids would receive direct relief under the bill. 

That's an avg. payment of over $1k per household and 90% of DE households receiving a check.

I'm going to keep fighting for more direct payments.

1341196704624873477.text:
So here's where we are - I just voted to pass our next #COVID relief bill along with an end of year spending bill. 

The package isn't perfect - no bill of this size and scope is- & while the direct payments are less than @RepMcKinley & I proposed, I voted yes. Here's why 👇🏽

1340815233984696322.text: This package can act as a bridge through the holidays, & I look forward to working with the Biden-Harris Administration to secure additional relief.

1340815232978067456.text: While the package will provide much-needed assistance for the American people, our work is far from over. The American people need additional relief as soon as possible.

1340815227860955136.text: I’m pleased that Congressional leadership has agreed to a COVID-19 relief package, including direct payments, which I’ve advocated for, along with concrete wins for Delaware such as funding for testing and vaccine distribution, relief for small businesses, & broadband.

1334925675652853762.text: We still have much more work to do when it comes to criminal justice reform, but the passage of the MORE Act is a critical step in the right direction.

1334925674906267649.text: That’s why I was proud to vote for the MORE Act, removing marijuana as a controlled substance, creating a new tax structure for cannabis products, and continuing the hard work of reversing the decades of damaging marijuana criminalization at the federal level.

1334925674193301505.text: It has been clear for some time from a scientific and criminal justice perspective that marijuana does not belong on the federal Controlled Substances list.

1334925673450844162.text:
One of the most tragic and longest-lasting impacts of our system is the way in which our society treats marijuana offenses. 

From housing to education, to employment, too-often, nonviolent drug offenses act as a seemingly immovable barrier for too many Americans.

1242939247608414208.text: The bill is not perfect - no bill this size is perfect - but we cannot let perfect be the enemy of progress during a national crisis. American families, workers, and small businesses are hurting and this is no time for delay.
